02811           CMU->CTRL = (CMU->CTRL & ~(_CMU_CTRL_DBGCLK_MASK))
02812                       | CMU_CTRL_DBGCLK_AUXHFRCO;
02813           break;
02814 
02815         case cmuSelect_HFCLK:
02816           /* Select divided HFCLK as debug clock */
02817           CMU->CTRL = (CMU->CTRL & ~(_CMU_CTRL_DBGCLK_MASK))
02818                       | CMU_CTRL_DBGCLK_HFCLK;
02819           break;
02820 #endif
02821 
02822         default:
02823           /* Illegal clock source for debug selected */
02824           EFM_ASSERT(0);
02825           return;
02826       }
02827       break;
02828 #endif
02829 
02830 #if defined(USB_PRESENT)
02831     case CMU_USBCCLKSEL_REG:
02832       switch(ref)
02833       {
02834         case cmuSelect_LFXO:
02835           /* Select LFXO as clock source for USB, can only be used in sleep mode */
02836           /* Ensure selected oscillator is enabled, waiting for it to stabilize */
02837           CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, true, true);
02838 
02839           /* Switch oscillator */
02840           CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_USBCCLKSEL_LFXO;
02841 
02842           /* Wait until clock is activated */
02843           while((CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_USBCLFXOSEL)==0)
02844           {
02845           }
02846           break;
02847 
02848         case cmuSelect_LFRCO:
02849           /* Select LFRCO as clock source for USB, can only be used in sleep mode */
02850           /* Ensure selected oscillator is enabled, waiting for it to stabilize */
02851           CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFRCO, true, true);
02852 
02853           /* Switch oscillator */
02854           CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_USBCCLKSEL_LFRCO;
02855 
02856           /* Wait until clock is activated */
02857           while((CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_USBCLFRCOSEL)==0)
02858           {
02859           }
02860           break;
02861 
02862 #if defined( CMU_STATUS_USBCHFCLKSEL )
02863         case cmuSelect_HFCLK:
02864           /* Select undivided HFCLK as clock source for USB */
02865           /* Oscillator must already be enabled to avoid a core lockup */
02866           CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_USBCCLKSEL_HFCLKNODIV;
02867           /* Wait until clock is activated */
02868           while((CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_USBCHFCLKSEL)==0)
02869           {
02870           }
02871           break;
02872 #endif
02873 
02874 #if defined( CMU_CMD_USBCCLKSEL_USHFRCO )
02875         case cmuSelect_USHFRCO:
02876           /* Select USHFRCO as clock source for USB */
02877           /* Ensure selected oscillator is enabled, waiting for it to stabilize */
02878           CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_USHFRCO, true, true);
02879 
02880           /* Switch oscillator */
02881           CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_USBCCLKSEL_USHFRCO;
02882 
02883           /* Wait until clock is activated */
02884           while((CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_USBCUSHFRCOSEL)==0)
02885           {
02886           }
02887           break;
02888 #endif
02889 
02890         default:
02891           /* Illegal clock source for USB */
02892           EFM_ASSERT(0);
02893           return;
02894       }
02895       break;
02896 #endif
02897 
02898     default:
02899       EFM_ASSERT(0);
02900       break;
02901   }
02902 }
02903 
02904 
02905 /**************************************************************************/
02934 void CMU_FreezeEnable(bool enable)
02935 {
02936   if (enable)
02937   {
02938     /* Wait for any ongoing LF synchronization to complete. This is just to */
02939     /* protect against the rare case when a user                            */
02940     /* - modifies a register requiring LF sync                              */
02941     /* - then enables freeze before LF sync completed                       */
02942     /* - then modifies the same register again                              */
02943     /* since modifying a register while it is in sync progress should be    */
02944     /* avoided.                                                             */
02945     while (CMU->SYNCBUSY)
02946     {
02947     }
02948 
02949     CMU->FREEZE = CMU_FREEZE_REGFREEZE;
02950   }
02951   else
02952   {
02953     CMU->FREEZE = 0;
02954   }
02955 }
02956 
02957 
02958 #if defined( _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK )
02959 /***************************************************************************/
02966 CMU_HFRCOBand_TypeDef CMU_HFRCOBandGet(void)
02967 {
02968   return (CMU_HFRCOBand_TypeDef)((CMU->HFRCOCTRL & _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK)
02969                                  >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_SHIFT);
02970 }
02971 #endif /* _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK */
02972 
02973 
02974 #if defined( _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK )
02975 /***************************************************************************/
02983 void CMU_HFRCOBandSet(CMU_HFRCOBand_TypeDef band)
02984 {
02985   uint32_t           tuning;
02986   uint32_t           freq;
02987   CMU_Select_TypeDef osc;
02988 
02989   /* Read tuning value from calibration table */
02990   switch (band)
02991   {
02992     case cmuHFRCOBand_1MHz:
02993       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND1_MASK)
02994                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND1_SHIFT;
02995       break;
02996 
02997     case cmuHFRCOBand_7MHz:
02998       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND7_MASK)
02999                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND7_SHIFT;
03000       break;
03001 
03002     case cmuHFRCOBand_11MHz:
03003       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND11_MASK)
03004                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND11_SHIFT;
03005       break;
03006 
03007     case cmuHFRCOBand_14MHz:
03008       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND14_MASK)
03009                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL0_BAND14_SHIFT;
03010       break;
03011 
03012     case cmuHFRCOBand_21MHz:
03013       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL1 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL1_BAND21_MASK)
03014                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL1_BAND21_SHIFT;
03015       break;
03016 
03017 #if defined( _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_28MHZ )
03018     case cmuHFRCOBand_28MHz:
03019       tuning = (DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL1 & _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL1_BAND28_MASK)
03020                >> _DEVINFO_HFRCOCAL1_BAND28_SHIFT;
03021       break;
03022 #endif
03023 
03024     default:
03025       EFM_ASSERT(0);
03026       return;
03027   }
03028 
03029   /* If HFRCO is used for core clock, we have to consider flash access WS. */
03030   osc = CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF);
03031   if (osc == cmuSelect_HFRCO)
03032   {
03033     /* Configure worst case wait states for flash access before setting divider */
03034     flashWaitStateMax();
03035   }
03036 
03037   /* Set band/tuning */
03038   CMU->HFRCOCTRL = (CMU->HFRCOCTRL &
03039                     ~(_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK | _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK))
03040                    | (band << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_SHIFT)
03041                    | (tuning << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03042 
03043   /* If HFRCO is used for core clock, optimize flash WS */
03044   if (osc == cmuSelect_HFRCO)
03045   {
03046     /* Update CMSIS core clock variable and get current core clock */
03047     /* (The function will update the global variable) */
03048     /* NOTE! We need at least 21 cycles before setting zero wait state to flash */
03049     /* (i.e. WS0) when going from the 28MHz to 1MHz in the HFRCO band */
03050     freq = SystemCoreClockGet();
03051 
03052     /* Optimize flash access wait state setting for current core clk */
03053     flashWaitStateControl(freq);
03054   }
03055 }
03056 #endif /* _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_BAND_MASK */
03057 
03058 
03059 #if defined( _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_MASK )
03060 /**************************************************************************/
03070 uint32_t* CMU_HFRCODevinfoGet(CMU_HFRCOFreq_TypeDef freq)
03071 {
03072   switch (freq)
03073   {
03074     /* 1, 2 and 4MHz share the same calibration word */
03075     case cmuHFRCOFreq_1M0Hz:
03076     case cmuHFRCOFreq_2M0Hz:
03077     case cmuHFRCOFreq_4M0Hz:
03078       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 0);
03079 
03080     case cmuHFRCOFreq_7M0Hz:
03081       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 3);
03082 
03083     case cmuHFRCOFreq_13M0Hz:
03084       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 6);
03085 
03086     case cmuHFRCOFreq_16M0Hz:
03087       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 7);
03088 
03089     case cmuHFRCOFreq_19M0Hz:
03090       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 8);
03091 
03092     case cmuHFRCOFreq_26M0Hz:
03093       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 10);
03094 
03095     case cmuHFRCOFreq_32M0Hz:
03096       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 11);
03097 
03098     case cmuHFRCOFreq_38M0Hz:
03099       return (uint32_t *)(&DEVINFO->HFRCOCAL0 + 12);
03100 
03101     default: /* cmuHFRCOFreq_UserDefined */
03102       return NULL;
03103   }
03104 }
03105 
03106 
03107 /***************************************************************************/
03114 CMU_HFRCOFreq_TypeDef CMU_HFRCOFreqGet(void)
03115 {
03116   return (CMU_HFRCOFreq_TypeDef)SystemHfrcoFreq;
03117 }
03118 
03119 
03120 /***************************************************************************/
03127 void CMU_HFRCOFreqSet(CMU_HFRCOFreq_TypeDef freq)
03128 {
03129   uint32_t* freqCalDevinfo;
03130   uint32_t freqCal;
03131   uint32_t ctrlReg;
03132 
03133   /* Get DEVINFO index, set frequency */
03134   freqCalDevinfo = CMU_HFRCODevinfoGet(freq);
03135   EFM_ASSERT(freqCalDevinfo != NULL);
03136   freqCal = *freqCalDevinfo;
03137   SystemHfrcoFreq = (uint32_t)freq;
03138 
03139   /* Set max wait-states while changing core clock */
03140   if (CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF) == cmuSelect_HFRCO)
03141   {
03142     flashWaitStateMax();
03143   }
03144 
03145   /* If calibration is present in DEVINFO, set calibration data for the selected
03146      frequency. Wait for any previous sync to complete first. */
03147   while(BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->SYNCBUSY, _CMU_SYNCBUSY_HFRCOBSY_SHIFT))
03148   {
03149   }
03150   if (freqCal != ~0U)
03151   {
03152     switch(freq)
03153     {
03154       case cmuHFRCOFreq_1M0Hz:
03155         freqCal = (freqCal & ~_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_MASK)
03156                   | (2 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03157         break;
03158 
03159       case cmuHFRCOFreq_2M0Hz:
03160         freqCal = (freqCal & ~_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_MASK)
03161                   | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03162         break;
03163 
03164       default:
03165         break;
03166     }
03167     CMU->HFRCOCTRL = freqCal;
03168   }
03169   else
03170   {
03171     /* Calibration data does not exist, set best known approximation. */
03172     ctrlReg = _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_RESETVALUE & ~(_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_MASK
03173                                             | _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_MASK
03174                                             | _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_MASK);
03175 
03176     switch(freq)
03177     {
03178       case cmuHFRCOFreq_1M0Hz:
03179         ctrlReg |= (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03180                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03181                    | (2 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03182         break;
03183 
03184       case cmuHFRCOFreq_2M0Hz:
03185         ctrlReg |= (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03186                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03187                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03188         break;
03189 
03190       case cmuHFRCOFreq_4M0Hz:
03191         ctrlReg |= (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03192                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03193                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03194         break;
03195 
03196       case cmuHFRCOFreq_7M0Hz:
03197         ctrlReg |= (3 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03198                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03199                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03200         break;
03201 
03202       case cmuHFRCOFreq_13M0Hz:
03203         ctrlReg |= (6 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03204                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03205                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03206         break;
03207 
03208       case cmuHFRCOFreq_16M0Hz:
03209         ctrlReg |= (7 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03210                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03211                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03212         break;
03213 
03214       case cmuHFRCOFreq_19M0Hz:
03215         ctrlReg |= (8 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03216                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03217                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03218         break;
03219 
03220       case cmuHFRCOFreq_26M0Hz:
03221         ctrlReg |= (10 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03222                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03223                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03224         break;
03225 
03226       case cmuHFRCOFreq_32M0Hz:
03227         ctrlReg |= (11 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03228                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03229                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03230         break;
03231 
03232       case cmuHFRCOFreq_38M0Hz:
03233         ctrlReg |= (12 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_SHIFT)
03234                    | (1 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_LDOHP_SHIFT)
03235                    | (0 << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_CLKDIV_SHIFT);
03236         break;
03237 
03238       default:
03239         EFM_ASSERT(0);
03240         break;
03241     }
03242     CMU->HFRCOCTRL = ctrlReg;
03243   }
03244   /* Optimize flash access wait-state configuration for this frequency, */
03245   /* if HFRCO is reference for core clock.                              */
03246   if (CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF) == cmuSelect_HFRCO)
03247   {
03248     flashWaitStateControl((uint32_t)freq);
03249   }
03250 }
03251 #endif /* _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_FREQRANGE_MASK */
03252 
03253 #if defined( _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_MASK )
03254 /***************************************************************************/
03264 uint32_t CMU_HFRCOStartupDelayGet(void)
03265 {
03266   return (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_MASK)
03267          >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_SHIFT;
03268 }
03269 
03270 
03271 /***************************************************************************/
03281 void CMU_HFRCOStartupDelaySet(uint32_t delay)
03282 {
03283   EFM_ASSERT(delay <= 31);
03284 
03285   delay &= _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_MASK >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_SHIFT;
03286   CMU->HFRCOCTRL = (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & ~(_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_MASK))
03287                    | (delay << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_SUDELAY_SHIFT);
03288 }
03289 #endif
03290 
03291 
03292 #if defined( _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK )
03293 /***************************************************************************/
03313 void CMU_HFXOAutostartEnable(bool enRACStartSel,
03314                              bool enEM0EM1Start,
03315                              bool enEM0EM1StartSel)
03316 {
03317   uint32_t hfxoCtrl;
03318   hfxoCtrl = CMU->HFXOCTRL & ~(_CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK
03319                               | _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTEM0EM1_MASK
03320                               | _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1_MASK);
03321 
03322   hfxoCtrl |= (enRACStartSel ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC : 0)
03323               | (enEM0EM1Start ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTEM0EM1 : 0)
03324               | (enEM0EM1StartSel ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1 : 0);
03325 
03326   CMU->HFXOCTRL = hfxoCtrl;
03327 }
03328 #endif /* _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK */
03329 
03330 
03331 #if defined( _CMU_HFXOCTRL_MASK )
03332 /**************************************************************************/
03343 void CMU_HFXOInit(CMU_HFXOInit_TypeDef *hfxoInit)
03344 {
03345   uint32_t reg;
03346 
03347   /* Do not disable HFXO if it is currently selected as HF/Core clock */
03348   EFM_ASSERT(CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF) != cmuSelect_HFXO);
03349 
03350   /* HFXO must be disabled before reconfiguration */
03351   CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_HFXO, false, false);
03352 
03353   /* Apply control settings */
03354   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->HFXOCTRL,
03355                      _CMU_HFXOCTRL_LOWPOWER_MASK
03356 #if defined( _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK )
03357                      | _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK
03358 #endif
03359                      | _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTEM0EM1_MASK
03360                      | _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1_MASK,
03361                      (hfxoInit->lowPowerMode
03362                       ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_LOWPOWER : 0)
03363 #if defined( _CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC_MASK )
03364                      | (hfxoInit->autoStartSelOnRacWakeup
03365                         ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTRDYSELRAC : 0)
03366 #endif
03367                      | (hfxoInit->autoStartEm01
03368                         ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1 : 0)
03369                      | (hfxoInit->autoSelEm01
03370                         ? CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1 : 0));
03371 
03372   /* Set XTAL tuning parameters */
03373 
03374   /* Set peak detection threshold (currently hidden) */
03375   BUS_RegMaskedWrite((volatile uint32_t *)0x400E4028, 0x7, hfxoInit->thresholdPeakDetect);
03376 
03377   /* Set current and cap tuning for startup and steady state */
03378   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->HFXOSTARTUPCTRL,
03379                      _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_CTUNE_MASK
03380                      | _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_REGISHWARM_MASK
03381                      | _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_IBTRIMXOCORE_MASK,
03382                      (hfxoInit->ctuneStartup
03383                       << _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_CTUNE_SHIFT)
03384                      | (hfxoInit->regIshStartup
03385                         << _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_REGISHWARM_SHIFT)
03386                      | (hfxoInit->ibTrimStartup
03387                         << _CMU_HFXOSTARTUPCTRL_IBTRIMXOCORE_SHIFT));
03388 
03389   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL,
03390                      _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_CTUNE_MASK
03391                      | _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISH_MASK
03392                      | _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_IBTRIMXOCORE_MASK,
03393                      (hfxoInit->ctuneSteadyState
03394                       << _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_CTUNE_SHIFT)
03395                      | (hfxoInit->regIshSteadyState
03396                         << _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISH_SHIFT)
03397                      | (hfxoInit->ibTrimSteadyState
03398                         << _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_IBTRIMXOCORE_SHIFT));
03399 
03400   /* Adjust CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER according to regIshSteadyState.
03401      Saturate at max value. */
03402   reg = hfxoInit->regIshSteadyState + 3;
03403   if (reg > (_CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER_MASK
03404              >> _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER_SHIFT))
03405   {
03406     BUS_RegMaskedSet(&CMU->HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL,
03407                      _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER_MASK);
03408   }
03409   else
03410   {
03411     reg <<= _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER_SHIFT;
03412     BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL,
03413                        _CMU_HFXOSTEADYSTATECTRL_REGISHUPPER_MASK, reg);
03414   }
03415 
03416   /* Set timeouts */
03417   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL,
03418                      _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_SHUNTOPTTIMEOUT_MASK
03419                      | _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_PEAKDETTIMEOUT_MASK
03420                      | _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_WARMSTEADYTIMEOUT_MASK
03421                      | _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_STEADYTIMEOUT_MASK
03422                      | _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_STARTUPTIMEOUT_MASK,
03423                      (hfxoInit->timeoutShuntOptimization
03424                       << _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_SHUNTOPTTIMEOUT_SHIFT)
03425                      | (hfxoInit->timeoutPeakDetect
03426                         << _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_PEAKDETTIMEOUT_SHIFT)
03427                      | (hfxoInit->timeoutWarmSteady
03428                         << _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_WARMSTEADYTIMEOUT_SHIFT)
03429                      | (hfxoInit->timeoutSteady
03430                         << _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_STEADYTIMEOUT_SHIFT)
03431                      | (hfxoInit->timeoutStartup
03432                         << _CMU_HFXOTIMEOUTCTRL_STARTUPTIMEOUT_SHIFT));
03433 }
03434 #endif
03435 
03436 
03437 /***************************************************************************/
03444 uint32_t CMU_LCDClkFDIVGet(void)
03445 {
03446 #if defined( LCD_PRESENT )
03447   return (CMU->LCDCTRL & _CMU_LCDCTRL_FDIV_MASK) >> _CMU_LCDCTRL_FDIV_SHIFT;
03448 #else
03449   return 0;
03450 #endif /* defined(LCD_PRESENT) */
03451 }
03452 
03453 
03454 /***************************************************************************/
03467 void CMU_LCDClkFDIVSet(uint32_t div)
03468 {
03469 #if defined( LCD_PRESENT )
03470   EFM_ASSERT(div <= cmuClkDiv_128);
03471 
03472   /* Do not allow modification if LCD clock enabled */
03473   if (CMU->LFACLKEN0 & CMU_LFACLKEN0_LCD)
03474   {
03475     return;
03476   }
03477 
03478   div        <<= _CMU_LCDCTRL_FDIV_SHIFT;
03479   div         &= _CMU_LCDCTRL_FDIV_MASK;
03480   CMU->LCDCTRL = (CMU->LCDCTRL & ~_CMU_LCDCTRL_FDIV_MASK) | div;
03481 #else
03482   (void)div;  /* Unused parameter */
03483 #endif /* defined(LCD_PRESENT) */
03484 }
03485 
03486 
03487 #if defined( _CMU_LFXOCTRL_MASK )
03488 /**************************************************************************/
03499 void CMU_LFXOInit(CMU_LFXOInit_TypeDef *lfxoInit)
03500 {
03501   /* Do not disable LFXO if it is currently selected as HF/Core clock */
03502   EFM_ASSERT(CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF) != cmuSelect_HFXO);
03503 
03504   /* LFXO must be disabled before reconfiguration */
03505   CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, false, false);
03506 
03507   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&CMU->LFXOCTRL,
03508                      _CMU_LFXOCTRL_TUNING_MASK
03509                      | _CMU_LFXOCTRL_GAIN_MASK
03510                      | _CMU_LFXOCTRL_TIMEOUT_MASK,
03511                      (lfxoInit->ctune << _CMU_LFXOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT)
03512                      | (lfxoInit->gain << _CMU_LFXOCTRL_GAIN_SHIFT)
03513                      | (lfxoInit->timeout << _CMU_LFXOCTRL_TIMEOUT_SHIFT));
03514 }
03515 #endif
03516 
03517 
03518 /***************************************************************************/
03542 void CMU_OscillatorEnable(CMU_Osc_TypeDef osc, bool enable, bool wait)
03543 {
03544   uint32_t rdyBitPos;
03545 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03546   uint32_t ensBitPos;
03547 #endif
03548   uint32_t enBit;
03549   uint32_t disBit;
03550 
03551   switch (osc)
03552   {
03553     case cmuOsc_HFRCO:
03554       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_HFRCOEN;
03555       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_HFRCODIS;
03556       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_HFRCORDY_SHIFT;
03557 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03558       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_HFRCOENS_SHIFT;
03559 #endif
03560       break;
03561 
03562     case cmuOsc_HFXO:
03563       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_HFXOEN;
03564       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_HFXODIS;
03565       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_HFXORDY_SHIFT;
03566 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03567       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_HFXOENS_SHIFT;
03568 #endif
03569       break;
03570 
03571     case cmuOsc_AUXHFRCO:
03572       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_AUXHFRCOEN;
03573       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_AUXHFRCODIS;
03574       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_AUXHFRCORDY_SHIFT;
03575 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03576       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_AUXHFRCOENS_SHIFT;
03577 #endif
03578       break;
03579 
03580     case cmuOsc_LFRCO:
03581       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_LFRCOEN;
03582       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_LFRCODIS;
03583       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_LFRCORDY_SHIFT;
03584 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03585       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_LFRCOENS_SHIFT;
03586 #endif
03587       break;
03588 
03589     case cmuOsc_LFXO:
03590       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_LFXOEN;
03591       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_LFXODIS;
03592       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_LFXORDY_SHIFT;
03593 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03594       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS_SHIFT;
03595 #endif
03596       break;
03597 
03598 #if defined( _CMU_STATUS_USHFRCOENS_MASK )
03599     case cmuOsc_USHFRCO:
03600       enBit  = CMU_OSCENCMD_USHFRCOEN;
03601       disBit = CMU_OSCENCMD_USHFRCODIS;
03602       rdyBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_USHFRCORDY_SHIFT;
03603 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03604       ensBitPos = _CMU_STATUS_USHFRCOENS_SHIFT;
03605 #endif
03606       break;
03607 #endif
03608 
03609 #if defined( CMU_LFCLKSEL_LFAE_ULFRCO )
03610     case cmuOsc_ULFRCO:
03611       /* ULFRCO is always enabled, and cannot be turned off */
03612       return;
03613 #endif
03614 
03615     default:
03616       /* Undefined clock source */
03617       EFM_ASSERT(0);
03618       return;
03619   }
03620 
03621   if (enable)
03622   {
03623     CMU->OSCENCMD = enBit;
03624 
03625 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03626     /* Always wait for ENS to go high */
03627     while (!BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->STATUS, ensBitPos))
03628     {
03629     }
03630 #endif
03631 
03632     /* Wait for clock to become ready after enable */
03633     if (wait)
03634     {
03635       while (!BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->STATUS, rdyBitPos));
03636 #if defined( _CMU_STATUS_HFXOSHUNTOPTRDY_MASK )
03637       /* Wait for shunt current optimization to complete */
03638       if ((osc == cmuOsc_HFXO)
03639           && (BUS_RegMaskedRead(&CMU->HFXOCTRL,
03640                                 _CMU_HFXOCTRL_PEAKDETSHUNTOPTMODE_MASK)
03641               == CMU_HFXOCTRL_PEAKDETSHUNTOPTMODE_AUTOCMD))
03642       {
03643         while (!BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->STATUS, _CMU_STATUS_HFXOSHUNTOPTRDY_SHIFT))
03644         {
03645         }
03646         /* Assert on failed peak detection. Incorrect HFXO initialization parameters
03647            caused startup to fail. Please review parameters. */
03648         EFM_ASSERT(BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->STATUS, _CMU_STATUS_HFXOPEAKDETRDY_SHIFT));
03649       }
03650 #endif
03651     }
03652   }
03653   else
03654   {
03655     CMU->OSCENCMD = disBit;
03656 
03657 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03658     /* Always wait for ENS to go low */
03659     while (BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->STATUS, ensBitPos))
03660     {
03661     }
03662 #endif
03663   }
03664 
03665   /* Keep EMU module informed */
03666   EMU_UpdateOscConfig();
03667 }
03668 
03669 
03670 /***************************************************************************/
03683 uint32_t CMU_OscillatorTuningGet(CMU_Osc_TypeDef osc)
03684 {
03685   uint32_t ret;
03686 
03687   switch (osc)
03688   {
03689     case cmuOsc_LFRCO:
03690       ret = (CMU->LFRCOCTRL & _CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK)
03691             >> _CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT;
03692       break;
03693 
03694     case cmuOsc_HFRCO:
03695       ret = (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK)
03696             >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT;
03697       break;
03698 
03699     case cmuOsc_AUXHFRCO:
03700       ret = (CMU->AUXHFRCOCTRL & _CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK)
03701             >> _CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT;
03702       break;
03703 
03704     default:
03705       EFM_ASSERT(0);
03706       ret = 0;
03707       break;
03708   }
03709 
03710   return(ret);
03711 }
03712 
03713 
03714 /***************************************************************************/
03732 void CMU_OscillatorTuningSet(CMU_Osc_TypeDef osc, uint32_t val)
03733 {
03734   switch (osc)
03735   {
03736     case cmuOsc_LFRCO:
03737       EFM_ASSERT(val <= (_CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK
03738                          >> _CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT));
03739       val &= (_CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK >> _CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03740 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03741       while(BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->SYNCBUSY, _CMU_SYNCBUSY_LFRCOBSY_SHIFT));
03742 #endif
03743       CMU->LFRCOCTRL = (CMU->LFRCOCTRL & ~(_CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK))
03744                        | (val << _CMU_LFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03745       break;
03746 
03747     case cmuOsc_HFRCO:
03748       EFM_ASSERT(val <= (_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK
03749                          >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT));
03750       val &= (_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK >> _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03751 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03752       while(BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->SYNCBUSY, _CMU_SYNCBUSY_HFRCOBSY_SHIFT))
03753       {
03754       }
03755 #endif
03756       CMU->HFRCOCTRL = (CMU->HFRCOCTRL & ~(_CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK))
03757                        | (val << _CMU_HFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03758       break;
03759 
03760     case cmuOsc_AUXHFRCO:
03761       EFM_ASSERT(val <= (_CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK
03762                          >> _CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT));
03763       val &= (_CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK >> _CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03764 #if defined( _SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2 )
03765       while(BUS_RegBitRead(&CMU->SYNCBUSY, _CMU_SYNCBUSY_AUXHFRCOBSY_SHIFT))
03766       {
03767       }
03768 #endif
03769       CMU->AUXHFRCOCTRL = (CMU->AUXHFRCOCTRL & ~(_CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK))
03770                           | (val << _CMU_AUXHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03771       break;
03772 
03773     default:
03774       EFM_ASSERT(0);
03775       break;
03776   }
03777 }

03780 /**************************************************************************/
03791 bool CMU_PCNTClockExternalGet(unsigned int instance)
03792 {
03793   uint32_t setting;
03794 
03795   switch (instance)
03796   {
03797 #if defined( _CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT0CLKEN_MASK )
03798     case 0:
03799       setting = CMU->PCNTCTRL & CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT0CLKSEL_PCNT0S0;
03800       break;
03801 
03802 #if defined( _CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT1CLKEN_MASK )
03803     case 1:
03804       setting = CMU->PCNTCTRL & CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT1CLKSEL_PCNT1S0;
03805       break;
03806 
03807 #if defined( _CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT2CLKEN_MASK )
03808     case 2:
03809       setting = CMU->PCNTCTRL & CMU_PCNTCTRL_PCNT2CLKSEL_PCNT2S0;
03810       break;
03811 #endif
03812 #endif
03813 #endif
03814 
03815     default:
03816       setting = 0;
03817       break;
03818   }
03819   return (setting ? true : false);
03820 }

03823 /**************************************************************************/
03833 void CMU_PCNTClockExternalSet(unsigned int instance, bool external)
03834 {
03835 #if defined( PCNT_PRESENT )
03836   uint32_t setting = 0;
03837 
03838   EFM_ASSERT(instance < PCNT_COUNT);
03839 
03840   if (external)
03841   {
03842     setting = 1;
03843   }
03844 
03845   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(CMU->PCNTCTRL), (instance * 2) + 1, setting);
03846 
03847 #else
03848   (void)instance;  /* Unused parameter */
03849   (void)external;  /* Unused parameter */
03850 #endif
03851 }

03854 #if defined( _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_MASK )
03855 /***************************************************************************/
03862 CMU_USHFRCOBand_TypeDef CMU_USHFRCOBandGet(void)
03863 {
03864   return (CMU_USHFRCOBand_TypeDef)((CMU->USHFRCOCONF
03865                                     & _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_MASK)
03866                                    >> _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_SHIFT);
03867 }
03868 #endif
03869 
03870 #if defined( _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_MASK )
03871 /***************************************************************************/
03878 void CMU_USHFRCOBandSet(CMU_USHFRCOBand_TypeDef band)
03879 {
03880   uint32_t           tuning;
03881   uint32_t           fineTuning;
03882   CMU_Select_TypeDef osc;
03883 
03884   /* Cannot switch band if USHFRCO is already selected as HF clock. */
03885   osc = CMU_ClockSelectGet(cmuClock_HF);
03886   EFM_ASSERT((CMU_USHFRCOBandGet() != band) && (osc != cmuSelect_USHFRCO));
03887 
03888   /* Read tuning value from calibration table */
03889   switch (band)
03890   {
03891     case cmuUSHFRCOBand_24MHz:
03892       tuning = (DEVINFO->USHFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND24_TUNING_MASK)
03893                >> _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND24_TUNING_SHIFT;
03894       fineTuning = (DEVINFO->USHFRCOCAL0
03895                     & _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND24_FINETUNING_MASK)
03896                    >> _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND24_FINETUNING_SHIFT;
03897       break;
03898 
03899     case cmuUSHFRCOBand_48MHz:
03900       tuning = (DEVINFO->USHFRCOCAL0 & _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND48_TUNING_MASK)
03901                >> _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND48_TUNING_SHIFT;
03902       fineTuning = (DEVINFO->USHFRCOCAL0
03903                     & _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND48_FINETUNING_MASK)
03904                    >> _DEVINFO_USHFRCOCAL0_BAND48_FINETUNING_SHIFT;
03905       /* Enable the clock divider before switching the band from 24 to 48MHz */
03906       BUS_RegBitWrite(&CMU->USHFRCOCONF, _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_USHFRCODIV2DIS_SHIFT, 0);
03907       break;
03908 
03909     default:
03910       EFM_ASSERT(0);
03911       return;
03912   }
03913 
03914   /* Set band and tuning */
03915   CMU->USHFRCOCONF = (CMU->USHFRCOCONF & ~_CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_MASK)
03916                      | (band << _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_BAND_SHIFT);
03917   CMU->USHFRCOCTRL = (CMU->USHFRCOCTRL & ~_CMU_USHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_MASK)
03918                      | (tuning << _CMU_USHFRCOCTRL_TUNING_SHIFT);
03919   CMU->USHFRCOTUNE = (CMU->USHFRCOTUNE & ~_CMU_USHFRCOTUNE_FINETUNING_MASK)
03920                      | (fineTuning << _CMU_USHFRCOTUNE_FINETUNING_SHIFT);
03921 
03922   /* Disable the clock divider after switching the band from 48 to 24MHz */
03923   if (band == cmuUSHFRCOBand_24MHz)
03924   {
03925     BUS_RegBitWrite(&CMU->USHFRCOCONF, _CMU_USHFRCOCONF_USHFRCODIV2DIS_SHIFT, 1);
03926   }
03927 }
03928 #endif
